laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 4: Calcium 7.6 mg/dL (hypocalcemia), Phosphate 7 mg/dL (elevated), Creatinine 77 mmol/L (mild increase), PTH 997 pg/mL (markedly elevated). At age 7: PTH 458 pg/mL (high), Calcium 7.9 mg/dL (hypocalcemia), Phosphate 9.2 mg/dL (hyperphosphatemia). At 4 months after kidney transplantation: PTH 23 pg/mL, normal Calcium and Phosphate levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PTH levels decreased from 458 pg/mL at age 7 to 23 pg/mL 4 months after transplantation. Calcium and Phosphate levels normalized post-transplantation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At age 4: TSH 5.66 mU/mL (increased), Free T4 at lower limit of normal. At age 7: TSH 4.40 mIU/mL (despite levothyroxine treatment).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: TSH remained at the upper limit of the normal range over time.
